name: places/ChIJJWByn_BZwokR9IC-3PtPPuk
formattedAddress: 174 E 82nd St, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 174 E 82nd St, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: Service was fantastic as this place just reopened (after a few decades hiatus). Food was definitely fired as we worked through our meal and it was spaced out appropriately. Garlic bread is over the top good and not as heavy as you'd think. We went more traditional with French onion soup and the roast chicken but tons of tables had the smashed burger. 10/10 will repeat

originalText.text: Highly recommend the french onion soup and the sundae. Garlic bread was bit too soggy for our liking although that is how it is supposed to be according to the waitress. Burger was also good but not anything too special. Sundae is a 10/10!

text.text: Highly recommend the french onion soup and the sundae. Garlic bread was bit too soggy for our liking although that is how it is supposed to be according to the waitress. Burger was also good but not anything too special. Sundae is a 10/10!

originalText.text: Amazing addition to the neighborhood! The food and drinks were spectacular but the host Lucy and our server Faith made the night exceptional! Do yourself a favor and try and snag one of the coveted tables here!

text.text: Amazing addition to the neighborhood! The food and drinks were spectacular but the host Lucy and our server Faith made the night exceptional! Do yourself a favor and try and snag one of the coveted tables here!

originalText.text:
Dined on a Friday evening with a group of five. Bar area is small and not conducive to ordering a drink while waiting for your table (which is okay, but notable). No complaints about the food at all. The service was not great but wasn’t bad enough specifically to merit a negative review.

However, what pushed me and my friends over the edge of frustration is the following event and how it was handled in such a disrespectful way by the restaurant staff:  Our table was singled out and we received a visit from the manager because another table complained about our noise level.  This was rich irony as we ourselves were already commenting about how loud the rest of the place was to begin with…we may have laughed a few times but we were by far not the most noisy group or close to it.  The restaurant is small and it was a Friday evening. The manner in which we were approached was condescending and it felt inappropriate to reprimand a table of happy people that are spending $500 plus to quiet down.  You don’t want to go out at the end of a week with your friends for a light but fun evening and leave feeling like your mood was influenced by an indifferent waitress and presumptive manager.  It’s definitely not a great approach to retain customers.  Hopefully these are just growing pains.

originalText.text: I went to the opening night of Hoexter’s on 11/25/23. I was very impressed with the experience, especially given that this was the restaurant’s first true dining service. We were immediately seated in a nice table in the corner. The mood was pleasant and welcoming. Our server was very nice and attentive. The cocktails were refreshing and welcoming. The garlic bread was phenomenal and unexpected. It is a must try. My family and I had a mix of entrees including pork Milanese, the NY strip, the calamari and the gem salad. All were delicious. The Milanese melted in my mouth. My wife’s steak was cooked to perfection. To be honest, I could not get enough of the Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes. I would highly recommend the restaurant.
